column4: if alsa can't find the control IEC958 .. then whats wrong.. tried this amixer set 'IEC958 Playback AC97-SPSA' 0
most likely the hardware doesn't support it.
possibly the kernel support for it isn't compiled in (or the module isn't loaded).
how do I see if the modules is loaded.. and where do I see which modules are loaded?
it says that the soundcard is loaded.. nothing specific about s-pdif thou..
does alsa autodetect stuff like s-pdif .. like on boot and such.
ordinarily, yes, but there can always be exceptions.
maybe I have to reload something. since I installed the s-pdif bracket afterwards
possible, yes.  there is a dpkg-reconfigure command you can run.
just type dpkg-reconfigure in terminal and enter?
no, we need the package name to reconfigure
is it the alsa-mixer or alsa something?
no, the mixer uses it, but the mixer is just an app
could be any of the alsa packages.  check for an audio howto, it might not address your specific issue, but it will certainly tell you in general the way to reconfigure.
when I type the aplay -l ... I only get up Analog.. no digital.. is it that digital istn't enabled and thats why alsa can't find my spdif?
I get .. card 0: NVidia [HDA NVidia] , device 0: ALC880 Analog [ALC880 Analog]
